result.execSummary:
The defendant Alan A Therriault was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court costs and victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.  To be collected by 7/24/17.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
*Restitution set at zero.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  To commence forthwith.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.  No alcohol or controlled substances.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alan A Therriault

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alan A Therriault not in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DEFENDANT IS DECEASED.
ANY FINE/FORFEITURES, COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES TO BE WAIVED.
ANY OUTSTANDING CIVIL JUDGMENTS, FINE & COST COMMITMENTS, SUSPENSIONS FOR DRIVING PRIVILEGES TO BE VACATED AND/OR WITHDRAWN.
Proof of death notification received from Department of Corrections on this date and forwarded to Court for review.
Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (30 pages) commencing JULY 22, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Alan A Therriault in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders stayed warrant lifted.   Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant.
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 2 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for one day.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by7/24/17; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 7/24/17; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Sentence to commence FORTHWITH. Defendant remanded.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court.  
Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Sentencing Hearing.  Defendant not present due to medical issue.  Defense motion to adjourn hearing heard and granted by the Court.  State has no objection.  Defendant to provide written proof on the next date.  The Court orders Bench Warrant Issued but Stayed until next date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, Sentencing Memorandum from the Wisconsin State Public Defender.

Defendant Alan A Therriault in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Case calendared for SENTENCING on 6/25/2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.
Defendant Alan A Therriault in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alan A Therriault in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defense counsel needs time to review the discovery. Case calendared for STATUS on 4/3/2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.

Defendant Alan A Therriault in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

The Court ordered no use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED NO LATER THAN 03-10-2015 BY 3:00 PM. FAILURE TO APPEAR WILL RESULT IN A BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Alan A Therriault in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3-9-2015 at 1:30pm
